helpModal.title: Help & Guide
helpModal.apiKeyDescription: Correctify uses OpenAI's API to provide grammar corrections. You need to provide your own API key to use the app.
helpModal.apiKeyStep2: Sign in or create an account if you don't have one
helpModal.apiKeyStep3: Click "Create new secret key" and copy it
helpModal.apiKeyStep4: Click the key icon in the top-right corner of this app
helpModal.apiKeyStep5: Paste your API key and save
helpModal.apiKeyNoteText: Your API key is stored locally on your device and never sent to any server other than OpenAI's API.
helpModal.inAppStep1: Type or paste text in the input field
helpModal.globalShortcutDescription: Correct text from any application using the global shortcut:
helpModal.globalShortcutStep1: Select and copy text in any app (
helpModal.globalShortcutTipText: The global shortcut works even when the app is minimized or in the background!
helpModal.globalShortcutCustomizationText: You can change both the modifier combination and the final key in Settings. The default is Cmd+Shift+] (or Ctrl+Shift+] on Windows/Linux). You can choose from 4 modifier combinations and use any key you prefer (A-Z, 0-9, or special keys).
helpModal.modelSelectionDescription: Choose the AI model that best fits your needs:
helpModal.model1Description: Fast and cost-effective. Great for most corrections.
helpModal.model2Description: More advanced. Better at complex grammar and style.
helpModal.model3Description: Most powerful. Best for nuanced corrections and tone adjustments.
helpModal.providersIntro: Correctify supports 4 LLM providers with 14 total models (10 paid, 4 free). You can add API keys for any or all providers.
helpModal.tryForFreeText: Create a free OpenRouter account and get instant access to 4 free models without adding a credit card. Perfect for testing Correctify!
helpModal.secureStorageText: API keys are now stored with OS-level encryption in your device's secure app data directory. Keys are never sent to any server except directly to your chosen LLM provider.
helpModal.autoCopyStep1: Select text in any app (just highlight, no copying needed)
helpModal.autoCopyStep3: Wait for the notification - corrected text pastes automatically!
helpModal.manualStep1: Select and copy text in any app (
helpModal.macosAccessibilityText: If using Auto Copy/Paste, you must grant Accessibility permissions to Correctify. Go to System Settings > Privacy & Security > Accessibility and enable Correctify. This allows the app to simulate keyboard input for seamless text correction.
helpModal.modelsIntro: Correctify now supports 14 models across 4 providers. Models are grouped by category:
helpModal.freeModelsTitle: Free Models (OpenRouter key required, no usage costs):
helpModal.modelGpt4oMini: Fast, affordable, recommended for most users
helpModal.smartFallbackText: If a paid model fails (e.g., insufficient credits), Correctify will offer to retry with a free OpenRouter model automatically.
helpModal.writingStyleIntro: Choose from 5 different writing styles to customize how your text is corrected and rewritten:
helpModal.styleGrammarOnlyDesc: Fixes grammar and typos only (default behavior)
helpModal.styleFormalDesc: Professional tone with no contractions, suitable for business or academic writing
helpModal.styleInformalDesc: Conversational and friendly tone with natural phrasing
helpModal.styleCollaborativeDesc: Inclusive team-oriented language with cooperative phrasing
helpModal.styleConciseDesc: Brief and to the point, removing redundancy while maintaining meaning
helpModal.writingStyleNoteText: Your selected writing style persists across sessions and is used for both in-app corrections and global shortcut corrections.
helpModal.usageStatsIntro: Track your LLM usage with built-in analytics. Click the Usage Stats button in the header menu to view:
helpModal.usageStatItem5: Filterable by time period (7/30/90 days, or all time)
helpModal.privacyText: All usage data is stored locally on your device and never shared with any server.
